page.title: 03New Forest-Trains, Dyke
page.content: Running through the centre of this area is the main London to Bournemouth railway line with trains coming along approximately every two minutes. This offers the opportunity for those people who are interested in train spotting. There is a level crossing for the visitor to reach the inclosures to the north. It is not possible for deer and ponies to cross this way. The former railway cottages here are now privately owned. For those people who are interested in historical sites there are, in the north-east of this area, some{tumuli. These are surrounded by{Bishop's Dyke. This is an earthen bank which is clearly visible in places and which encloses a large area of marsh, moorland and some trees. This was given to the Bishop of Winchester in 1284 in the reign of King Edward I.
